pages.text: "Pungent and aromatic, it warms the body and dispels cold. Bury it in soil, and new life shall sprout."$(br2)Ginger is a rhizome crop renowned for its distinctive spicy flavor and potent medicinal value. Whether used as a culinary seasoning or brewed into tea to ward off the chill, ginger remains an indispensable treasure.

Unlike ordinary crops, ginger requires no seeds. Travelers need only bury a piece of ginger in the soil to allow it to take root and thrive. It exhibits strong adaptability and grows particularly swiftly in warm, humid environments.

When mature, the ginger plant yields more rhizomes, which can be replanted for continuous propagation.$(br)Thanks to its vigorous vitality, ginger is ideal for cyclical cultivation, ensuring a stable supply of this precious crop for travelers.
